title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-19 - Certification of registration of an out-of-state order of custody or visitation - UCCJEA
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-19 - Certification of registration of an out-of-state order of custody or visitation - UCCJEA
State Regulations
DRL ยง 77-d Form UCCJEA-19
(Certification of Registration of Order of

Custody or Visitation--UCCJEA)
8/2002
________
In the Matter of a Proceeding for

Registration of an Out-of-State Order of Custody or

Visitation Order under the Uniform Child

Custody

Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act Docket

No. CERTIFICATION OF REGISTRATION
OF OUT-OF-STATE ORDER OF
CUSTODY OR VISITATION--UCCJEA
Petitioner, -against-
Respondent. ________
TO [specify name and address]: I, Clerk or the Family Court of the State
of New York, County of [specify]:, do hereby certify that the order or custody
or visitation, dated [specify]:, issued by the following court in the following
jurisdiction [specify]: has been registered in the State of New

York, pursuant to Section 77-d of the New York State Domestic Relations Law, and is deemed to have the same force and effect and is enforceable as if it
were by a Court of the State of New York. This order concerns the following
child(ren): Name(s) Date(s) of Birth

In testimony whereof, I have affixed the
seal of this Court this day of [specify]: _______________
Clerk of Court

Dated: Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child

Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-19

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
